Most companies offer training for staff to recognise these, but so many still fail to follow all the steps of verification of the legitimacy of emails.

It can be quite scary to think that the security of your business could be resting on how well a member of staff follows the training in recognising bogus emails.

hashtag

(1) An opportunity to rediscover whether or not you want to be in the area of work you're in -- yes, this can seem daunting, but it can also seem fun -- depending upon your perspective.
(2) PIVOT: It's a word that has become a fad right now -- but its true, you have every opportunity to start again. Scary? Most definitely. But regret can be even scarier. 
(3) Pick up a new skill, try a new idea, call your old business partner - push the envelope!
(4) Wake up daily with a goal in mind (i.e. I want to apply for 5 jobs today; then write 3 things you're grateful for (non-job related) -- Neuroscience shows you can't be grateful and anxious at the same time.

To all HRs, with love, from every professional ever:

-If you're not hiring, please remove any open positions from all job portals

-If you can't afford to onboard a new employee, let them know. Don't indefinitely defer their joining for nothing

-If a candidate is no longer in the running, let them know

-If you know you might be looking at laying people off in the times to come, communicate to them in time

-If someone completes an assignment as a part of the selection process, give them feedback. Don't let these creative people think their intellectual property was misused

-If you don't have the budget (+/- 10%), don't initiate the process. Don't put a candidate through so much only to put a shocking figure at the end

-If someone reaches out to you, be kind enough to acknowledge

-And lastly, if you want the industry to look up to your culture, preach it every step of the way. And yes, that includes treating potentially future employees with respect as well.

The above list is the result of innumerous stories from multiple people in my network. You have a massive responsibility, being the face of your company, dear HRs. Don't mess it up :)
